Title: The ARM processor (Thumb-2), part 3: Addressing modes | The Old New Thing
Description: The ARM processor employs a load-store architecture, but that doesnâ€™t mean that it has to skimp on the addressing modes. Every addressing mode starts with a base register. A base register of pc, may be used only in load instructions, and the value is rounded down to the nearest multiple of 4 before being used in calculations.

Title: Intl - JavaScript | MDN
Description: The Intl object is the namespace for the ECMAScript Internationalization API, which provides language sensitive string comparison, number formatting, and date and time formatting.
